comment: It's okay.   I find the it is easy to use. I have a few little issues when pausing a session and the sensors cut out.  A couple of anomalous top speed and elevation data when uploading to Strava. Though the graphs do seem accurate.   The GPS and offline maps work great and routing with the aid of Google or grasshopper also is snappy and quick to organise.   Sensor troubles aside. I find the app to be pretty decent and would recommend.

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Hi,
please write me a mail with some details and I will try to help you out.
Thank you
Robert

author: Antonio Occhipinti
comment: I used to use this app also for my walks but since last updates, I'm not able anymore to track them, when the speed is about between 6 and 13 km/h. Is it possible to fix?

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Antonio, please check "gps settings" in the settings to set-up the speed which determines if the app adds the last GPS segment to movement or if a pause is assumed or write me a mail.
Best regards
Robert

author: colin price
comment: Works really well. Like the customizable displays, audio updates & Strava sync. Only thing missing for me is .gpx uploads and the ability to follow the elevation profile like a Garmin does.

author: Harvey Livschitz
comment: Fantastic,I use it to replace a bike computer

author: Tony Hutson
comment: Great app. Thank you.  I have been using the pro version for about 8 months now. I have found ways to do everything that I need with it.   I like to access to the data so that I can post process it to provide the statistics that I require.  At present, I upload to Strava and then download the gpx file from there for my processing.  I do not hesitate to recommend BikeComputer pro to anyone who will listen to me.

author: Chris Kennedy
comment: Best of any HRM app. (I hope that one day it displays my power *while I ride*.

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Hi Christopher, registering a sensor is nothing more but to save its mac-address and connecting to it when starting a session. There should be no difference if you delete and re-register it. If you still have issues write me a mail and we can discuss this further.
Kind regards
Robert

author: Steve Hunter
comment: I like this app but I cannot get the speed function to work? Anyone got a suggestion.

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Hi Steve,
sorry for the late response. Did you get the speed to work ? If not just send me mail from inside the app and I will try to help you.
Best regards
Robert

author: Maxx Steele
comment: This app with offline GPS maps is all a biker needs.

author: Georgian Cernat
comment: Very detailed bike computer and the developer responds very quickly. Thanks

author: Don Tress
comment: Worth every penny. Just what I wanted no more second device
Provides good information for my short exercise rides.  I'm 67.

author: Dre F
comment: Perfect for keeping track of my bike rides
Great app to check your progress

author: Dan G
comment: Works perfect!

author: Stephen Nelson
comment: Love it.

author: Christopher Lomax
comment: Really good app for gps cycling computer. Just download routes from ridewithgps app on PC then email to yourself on phone. Thanks well worth the few quid.  Brought cheap spare Moto G 1st gen waterproof smartphone stick quadlock universal on back and you have relatively cheap cycle computer and the phones always available if you need it. PAYG sim with Three network with £5 credit but use offline maps. Credit lasts indefinitely. Can't recommend this app enough. Developer always replies to queries. Cheers

author: S.C. Colwell
comment: Has made finding, and staying on trails so much easier

author: Stephen Pegler
comment: Seems to work really nicely so far.

author: Go Danny
comment: Great support

This is the perfect app for my older, slow, Android 4.0 phone. The tech support from the author is quite fast and very helpful. I'm able to store all kinds of crazy data with it and download gpx files for use in other devices. I give it 5 stars.

author: Andrew Darnovsky
comment: App deserves top rating. Energy management options are reassuring for long trips. Too bad that imported routes have to be recalculated for turn by turn instructions.

author: Phillip Sargeant
comment: Great product...does what it says on the tin.... The display is well designed with all the information you need. It's great read a map again...just like ye older days.... Following the traditions of the Bauhaus "Form & Function"....  Phil

author: Brian Bledsoe
comment: This is well worth the price and upgrade from the free version. I like the simple and intuitive interface, and the developer is on top of updates and fixes. Everything I'd ask for in a cycling app is here!

author: Jay Newman
comment: Nice app, easy to figure out and use it's basic features, but no explanation or help for it's more "advanced" things it evidently can do.

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Hi Jay, you find tutorials in the app when using it the first time. Moreover there is a help option in the main screens menu. If something is not clear to you just write me a mail and I will try to help you out.
Best regards
Robert

author: Reid Welch
comment: It is stable and reliable for all the months I have used it.

author: david thompson
comment: Great cycle computer without social media nonsense.

author: Richard fisher
comment: As a newbie to cycling this does the job for me

author: John Steinbrecher
comment: Better than Strava

author: Przemysław Kras
comment: Excellent app !!!
I cycled the whole of the Rhine last year using the Bikeline gpx track and this app both were excellent.

author: simon wilson
comment: I know that when looking back at rides we can take the speed away to show alritude  is there anyway we can have it so u can choose what is removed speed or altitude would be so useful such a good app i love it but this would make it even better!!! Finding the new map types a bit annoying can't work out gradiants very easily was shocked to find one massive hill and no warning

Have looked at every application in this category and it's by Far and Away the best of its type. Doesn't really seem to overemphasize any particular quality but covers everything. But it's a German developed application so you would expect it to have a little more under the hood. Another example of sorts of superior German manufacturing and productivity.

author: Mike Mmm
comment: A fraud. Paid for Pro version couple years ago and now there is a Premium version that is extra paid ! Why have a paid for a Pro, lost some features to find it in "premium". LOL

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Hi Mike,
sorry, but there never was a feature in Pro what is now in Premium. All Premium features were newly developed.. This was actually an important point for me.
If you think that some feature was priorly available please contact me and we will discuss this
Best regards
Robert

comment: Works well.  I'd definitely recommend trying it before spending a lot of money on a dedicated bike computer.

author: Curtis M
comment: After two rides totalling just over 60 miles, I have to say I am happy with this app.

author: Wayne Bird
comment: This is a great app with even more potential. Keep up the great work and continue to develop it!

author: Ger Hennessy
comment: Great App

author: Edson Sandoval
comment: Works fine. Very accurate.

reply.author: RoProducts
reply.content:
Hi Edson,

sorry that you have issues downloading the maps. Did you check if a system  -side enery saving options prevents larger downloads. Alternatively you can download maps on your PC and copy them to the device. Please contact me for details.
Kind regards
Robert

author: Terry Cunningham
comment: Excellent app with great features
Handy and useful.
